meanings.definition: Not initiated or experienced in a particular activity or field.
meanings.sent1: The young recruit was unblooded in combat, but eager to learn.
meanings.sent2: She felt unblooded in the world of art, but her passion was undeniable.
meanings.sent3: The unblooded chef attempted to make a gourmet dish with disastrous results.
meanings.sent4: His unblooded status in politics made him an easy target for manipulation.
meanings.sent5: The unblooded adventurer set off on his first quest with determination.

meanings.sent1: The stray cat was unblooded, with no pedigree to boast of.
meanings.sent2: Despite being unblooded, she carried herself with grace and confidence.
meanings.sent3: The unblooded puppy tried to act regal but ended up chasing its tail.
meanings.sent4: In a world of unblooded rulers, she stood out with her royal lineage.
meanings.sent5: The unblooded family worked hard to create their own legacy.
